channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Before running the world’s most valuable company, Jensen Huang was a 9-year-old janitor in Kentucky
item.description: “It’s hard not to love this country," Huang said. "It’s hard not to be romantic about this country.”

item.title: Nintendo’s 98% staff retention rate means the average employee has been there 15 years
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Second Strike Scrutiny Obscures Larger Question About Trump’s Boat Attacks
item.description: Congress is focusing on two deaths in one strike. But nine other people died in that same attack, and the United States has killed 87 in all. Were any...

item.title: How the U.S. Focus on Fentanyl Helped Fuel the Cocaine Trade’s Resurgence
item.description: Across Latin America, there has been a surge in cocaine trafficking as Washington prioritized combating fentanyl. Times reporters traveled to Ecuador ...

item.title: Putin Basks in Praise From Modi on India Visit
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, underlining the close personal relationship between the leaders and their c...

item.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent insists Trump’s tariff agenda is ‘permanent,’ saying the White House can recreate it even with a Supreme Court loss
item.description: Using various other justifications, the White House can implement its tariffs regardless of a Supreme Court loss, said Bessent.

item.title: How a Texas gas producer plans to exploit the ‘mega trend’ of power plants for AI hyperscalers
item.description: BKV is growing both its shale gas and power generation footprints to attract AI data center campuses.

item.title: Fears Spread Over New ICE Crackdowns, and F.B.I. Makes Arrest in Jan. 6 Bomb Plot
The workplace needs to be designed like an ‘experience,’ says Gensler’s Ray Yuen, as employees resist the return to office
item.description: Employees don't want to return to the office. That poses a challenge for workplace designers like Yuen.

item.title: Trump’s Relationship With the President of FIFA

item.title: Air Traffic Control Issue Briefly Grounds Flights at Edinburgh Airport
item.description: The airport, Scotland’s busiest, said it had experienced a technical problem with its air traffic control provider. An hour later, flights had resumed...

item.title: Zelensky’s Government Sabotaged Oversight, Allowing Corruption in Ukraine to Fester
item.description: Ukrainian leaders blame independent advisers for failing to prevent graft. A Times investigation found that President Volodymyr Zelensky’s own adminis...

item.title: How the Hong Kong High-Rise Fire Became So Deadly
item.description: Hazardous construction materials, the buildings’ design and a series of safety failures likely enabled the blaze to spread with devastating speed.
